page.title: 02A LARGE FARM IN COCKFIELD
page.content: Mr.Cornell's Rookery Farm covers 530 acres.He grows wheat which takes up 200 acres.He also grows winter barley,spring barley and sugar beet which each cover 75 acres.Spring beans are grown on 50 acres.He has 45 acres of permanent grassland for animal feed. The other 10 acres are taken up by buildings and roads.After harvesting, the wheat is made into flour for bread, biscuits and animal feed.The winter barley is used for malting and the spring barley is used for further seed production.Spring beans are used for animal feed.Last of all is the sugar beet which is taken off to the Bury Sugar Beet Factory to be made into sugar.Mr.Cornell keeps pigs,cattle and sheep.The pigs are killed for bacon and pork,the cattle are killed for beef and the sheep are sold for breeding and wool.
